remarks: Define exclusive disjunction (logical 'xor').  Return true if either the left or right, but not both, are true.  After we define the constant true ` T. ` ( ~ df-tru ) and the constant false ` F. ` ( ~ df-fal ), we will be able to prove these truth table values: ` ( ( T. \/_ T. ) <-> F. ) ` ( ~ truxortru ), ` ( ( T. \/_ F. ) <-> T. ) ` ( ~ truxorfal ), ` ( ( F. \/_ T. ) <-> T. ) ` ( ~ falxortru ), and ` ( ( F. \/_ F. ) <-> F. ) ` ( ~ falxorfal ).  Contrast with ` /\ ` ( ~ df-an ), ` \/ ` ( ~ df-or ), ` -> ` ( ~ wi ), and ` -/\ ` ( ~ df-nan ) .  (Contributed by FL, 22-Nov-2010.)
